meanings.sent1: The nonvalid ticket was not allowed for entry.
meanings.sent2: The nonvalid document was rejected by the court.
meanings.sent3: The nonvalid excuse for being late didn't fool anyone.
meanings.sent4: Her nonvalid claim of being a princess was quickly debunked.
meanings.sent5: The nonvalid signature on the contract raised suspicions.

meanings.definition: Not based on truth or fact.
meanings.sent1: His nonvalid story about meeting a unicorn was unbelievable.
meanings.sent2: The nonvalid information led to confusion among the students.
meanings.sent3: The nonvalid rumor about aliens visiting Earth spread quickly.
meanings.sent4: Their nonvalid theory about time travel was quickly dismissed.
meanings.sent5: The nonvalid alibi fell apart under scrutiny.

meanings.definition: Not having any force or effect.
meanings.sent1: The nonvalid contract was not legally binding.
meanings.sent2: The nonvalid warranty did not cover any damages.
meanings.sent3: His nonvalid promise to always be on time was broken.
meanings.sent4: The nonvalid law was repealed due to public outcry.
meanings.sent5: The nonvalid coupon had already expired.
